biography.value:
Wearing fearsome masks, duergar mind masters usually operate as spies, both inside and beyond a duergar stronghold. Their psionically augmented abilities enable them to see through illusions with ease and shrink down to miniature size to spy on their targets.

Duergar

Duergar are dwarves of the deep reaches of the Underdark and other sunless realms. Their personalities and abilities have been deeply impacted by their ancestors’ captivity and torment by mind flayers; they were infused with powerful psionic abilities but also a profound gloom. In some, this strain of sorrow inspires works of grand but melancholic beauty, while in others, it manifests as rage.

Like many who dwell in the Underdark, duergar must constantly be on guard against the raids and plots of their neighbors. To this end, duergar warriors fulfill a variety of combat roles, often marrying their fury in battle with their psionic abilities or training dangerous Underdark creatures as mounts.

Denigrated by some as joyless, duergar are in fact deeply passionate in all that they do—even if that passion rarely manifests as mirth. They bring an emotional intensity to their lives, whether they’re exploring neighboring tunnels, defending their homes, engaging with their families, or crafting bold new works. The bonds of friendship and kinship are strong, though navigating the inevitable outbursts of frustration and despair is not always easy. Similarly, duergar tend to be very community-minded—in the Underdark, all must cooperate to survive.

Among the duergar of the Forgotten Realms, creation is a fiercely passionate process. They tend to favor works that are sturdy and grand, but in a bare, stripped-down fashion that favors geometric forms. The strongholds they design are blocky and stark, and the weapons they forge are blatantly tools of violence. While others may decry their creations as cold and bare of ornamentation to the point of austerity, duergar see them as honoring the materials used and honest about their purpose.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

The duergar makes two Mind-Poison Dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Mind Mastery.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 3d6 type=psychic average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1 piercing average=false]] damage plus [[/damage 3d6 type=psychic average=true]] damage while under the effect of Reduce.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The duergar magically turns &Reference[invisible]{invisible} for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its &Reference[concentration]{concentration} is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} with it.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The duergar targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a [[/save int 12 format=long]], or the duergar causes it to use its reaction, if available, either to make one weapon attack against another creature the duergar can see or to move up to 10 feet in a direction of the duergar’s choice. Creatures that can’t be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} are immune to this effect.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Duergar Resilience. The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed}, and &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} conditions.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
For 1 minute, the duergar magically decreases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While reduced, the duergar is Tiny, reduces its weapon damage to 1, and makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage if they use &Reference[str]{Strength}. It gains a +5 bonus to all &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks and a +5 bonus to its AC. It can also take a bonus action on each of its turns to take the Hide action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Reduce (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Reduce (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
